notes.note: Prereq: Previous course work in biology and sociology and health or a related area or permission of instructor.
Prerequisites: An introductory biology course or permission of instructor. 2 additional credits for students opting to take the 3 week intensive field trip.
lecture 2 is the 5 credit option with the field trip.
2 field trips.
Prerequisite: one year introductory biology or written permission of instructor. May not be taken for credit after BIOPL 2480.
An introductory course in biology or botany, or permission of instructor. May not be taken for credit after BIOPL 3470.

course.subject: BIOPL
course.course_title: Nutritional Quality Improvement of Food Crops

notes.note: Prerequisite: one majors level biology course or permission of instructors.

course.subject: BIOPL
course.course_title: Light and Video Microscopy for Biologists

course.subject: BIOPL
course.course_title: Plant Molecular Biology I: Concepts and Techniques of Plant Molecular Biology

notes.note: Prerequisites: BIOMG 2810 and 3300, 3330, 3350 or 3320, or equivalents. Recommended: BIOMG 3310.
Prerequisites: BIOMG 2810 and BIOMG3300 or 3320, or equivalents. Recommended: BIOMG 3310. 12 lectures.

Prerequisites: previous enrollment in course to be taught or equivalent. Note: Arts students may not count this course toward graduation but may, upon petition (one time only) to their class dean, carry fewer than 12 other credits and remain in good standing. This would affect Dean?s List eligibility but not eligibility for graduating with distinction. S?U or letter grades by permission of the instructor.
Prerequisites: BIOMG 2810 or equivalent, BIOMG 3300 or 3310 or equivalent, and permission of instructor. S-U grades by permission of instructor.
Requirement for graduate students doing work in plant biology.

course.subject: BIOPL
course.course_title: Faculty Research in Plant Cell and Molecular Biology

notes.note: Prerequisite: graduate standing or written permission from member of Plant Cell and Molecular Biology Program or from coordinator for undergraduates.
Requirement for, and limited to, second-, third-, and fourth-year graduate students in Plant Biology. Thursdays 12:20pm
Similar to BIOG 4990 but intended for graduate students who are working with faculty members on an individual basis. Sign into your faculty members section.
